results.firPara: Leicester City are busy making history again. No other English team have managed to win their first two Champions League matches. Leicesters 1-0 victory against Porto makes qualification to the knockout stages look distinctly possible with six points on the board already but whatever happens from now they hold the distinction of coming to terms with elevation to the Champions League more quickly than any of their illustrious predecessors.
results.secPara: On the domestic front, after three defeats in the opening six games, the history made last season is fast becoming a distant memory. The key to success last time was a solid start and managing to stay ahead for most of the campaign. Leicester have looked far from solid in the league and not just in conceding three goals from first-half corners at Manchester United last week. It is already being said – Claudio Ranieri is asked the question on a weekly basis – that subconsciously or otherwise Leicester are saving their best efforts for Europe this season.
results.webTitle: Leicester are passing their Champions League audition with flying colours | Paul Wilson

results.firPara: Son Heung-min has spoken of the heartbreak he felt at South Koreas failure to win a football medal at the Olympic Games in Rio de Janeiro, but the Tottenham Hotspur forward believes that he is stronger for the experience.
results.secPara: Son has come through a difficult time, with his club future having also been in the balance. He struggled to show his best form on a consistent basis after his £22m transfer from Bayer Leverkusen in August of last year, flitting in and out of the Spurs team, and he had resolved to return to the Bundesliga over the summer, with Wolfsburg having shown a particularly strong interest in him.
results.webTitle: Tottenham’s Son Heung-min speaks of South Korea’s Olympic disappointment

results.firPara: The appointment by England of a manager who had unanswered questions regarding transfers in the mid-2000s hanging over him was unusual and perhaps we should not be surprised he has gone so swiftly
results.secPara: Somewhere in the Football Associations Wembley archives, next to the battered bid books for the failed attempts to host 2006 and 2018 World Cup tournaments and Charles Hughess coaching manual, sit the files from a series of investigations in the middle of the last decade into a unique period in footballs recent history.
results.webTitle: Sam Allardyce: a history of suspicion and a dream job that ended after 67 days

results.firPara: He came, he smiled, he won a match and he left. Did Allardyce deserve to lose his job and which manager should be the next victim for the impossible job?
results.webTitle: Did Sam Allardyce have to go – and who should replace him as England manager?

results.firPara: Sam Allardyce, who left his post as England manager following revelations in an undercover newspaper investigation, spoke to reporters on Tuesday morning about his sadness at losing the job.
results.secPara: Allardyce, who was leaving for an overseas holiday with his family, said On reflection it was a silly thing to do. I was trying to help someone out I knew for 30 years and unfortunately it was an error in judgment on my behalf. Entrapment has won on this occasion and I have to accept that.
results.webTitle: Allardyce speaks of his sadness at losing England manager job to ‘entrapment’

results.firPara: Sometimes a football story so big breaks that the generators of tittle-tattle get distracted and lose focus on linking Player A with Club 2. This is one of those occasions. In case you have been living under a rock, you will have seen the big news by now. A story to tell the grandchildren. A real where were you? moment. Yes, folks.
results.secPara: Mesut Özil has agreed a new Arsenal deal, which according to the German press includes a clause that says he will get the No10 shirt. That number is currently occupied by Jack Wilshere, so that should not be much of a problem, even if Bournemouth, where the English midfielder has stayed fit for almost a month now, say they need to be realistic about their chances of signing him permanently.
results.webTitle: Football transfer rumours: Manchester United back in for José Fonte?
